intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. urezzae, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellowish to reddish composite flowers and hairy, basal leaves. This subspecies is typically found in calcareous grasslands and rocky habitats, often in regions with a temperate climate. Its botanical features include a short, upright stem and a distinctive inflorescence structure. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
